title: Reverting Search Panel behavior in URL/Address Bar
content:
With Firefox 83, the following change occurred:

  • Selecting a search engine at the bottom of the search panel [in the address bar] now enters search mode for that engine, allowing you to see suggestions (if available) for your search terms. The old behavior (immediately performing a search) is available with a shift-click.

I don't find this very useful since I have disabled search suggestions and would much rather have the old behavior of immediately performing a search when clicking the icon of my designed engine or site. My question is how do I disable the new change, and how do I re-enable the immediate search as default behavior so as to not have to shift-click for this?

Thank you.

title: popup that says "a webpage is slowing down your browser" what do you want to do

title: Video playback hangs on random YouTube videos, but sound still plays
content: For months now when on YouTube, on random videos, the video will hang right after they start playing, but the sound continues to play fine. I can play the same video on IE, Edge, etc, and they work fine. I was on an older version of Firefox, so I finally updated, hoping that this was the problem, but it's still doing it. I have been doing some troubleshooting, and have found that the videos play fine in Firefox if I run it in safe mode. I have just done a refresh on the browser, and have no addons installed except for the 2 default codec's required to play video, yet it is still hanging unless I am in safe mode. Other than no longer using Firefox, what can I do to fix this?

title: CORS and "Save Page As" functionality
content: A lot of websites are using some sort of API for their front-end, which usually have a CORS restriction, If a page is saved and opened locally, it usually does no longer satisfy CORS requirements and functionality which is based on external API is broken. How does this limitation is supposed to be resolved from the point of view of generic user? I know about the ways to disable CORS in browsers like extensions, command line parameters, proxies, etc, but those are a workarounds, there should be a supposed way to use one browser feature without breaking or disabling another, right? If its not present yet, is it planned to be added or is CORS supposed to always take precedence over how user wants to view a web page?

title: "HTTPS only" mode not working with Synology NAS HTTPS address
content:
"HTTPS only" mode not working with HTTPS address of Synology NAS

Hello . . . .

Only for some time now, I assume with the latest Firefox v83 / 64 or earlier that implement the "HTTPS only, I cannot connect to my Synology NAS via the typical fast domain of Synology NAS (the domain indicated is an invented name):

https: //RapidDemainSynology.test/ ****************** (MyReservedLogin)

The page tries to reload itself indefinitely without success by blinking continuously

After many attempts I found that if in Options> Privacy and security> HTTPS only mode, I disable the "HTTPS only mode" I can successfully connect to the NAS with the above address.

I also point out that the NAS address uses the https security protocol, therefore it should not be blocked by Firefox, while the opposite happens.

Moreover - for safety - I would like to be able to use the "HTTPS only" mode but I am forced to keep it disabled until a solution is found.

Is this a bug to report / fix?

In this case, how should a report be made? I am not very practical, however if someone tells me how to do it I can try.

Greetings . . .

title: can't import PKCS#12 files encrypted with AES-256
content:
Hello,

We have a compagny delivers us software certificates in PKCS # 12 format, encrypted in AES 256. The import of this file is OK in the Micorsoft certificate store. However, importing this same file into Firefox certificat manager does not work, with the following error message: "Failed to decode the file. Either it is not in PKCS # 12 format, or it is corrupted, or the password is incorrect."

For information, if we do the same procedure with a PFX encrypted in 3-DES, it's ok to import it into Firefox.


We tried with the following 2 versions of Firefox, same result. - 82.0.3 - 78.5.0 ESR

For information, if we do the same procedure with a PFX encrypted in 3-DES, it's ok to import it into Firefox.

Do you have any idea of ​​this bug to know the origin / possible corrections?

title: Very persistant Add-On without a name
content:
Hi FF-Community,

since a few days, I have a big problem with an Add-On in my Firefox-Installation:

As you can see in the picture, there is an Add-On wich adds Add to my Google search for example. The Add-On has no name and I can't deinstall it, it has no Add-On folder (like it is described for manually deinstallation for Add-Ons) and I can't deactivate it.

What I've done till now:

- tried to deinstall the Add-On via Firefox GUI - tried to deinstall it via deleting the Add-On folder in Profiles/XXX/extensions - deinstalled Firefox without synchronising Add-Ons, reinstalled it - searched with my anti-virus for Firefox-Spam

Nothing worked till now...I'm about to switch to Chrome because of this f** Add-On....

Thank you for your Help, Greetings....
creator: philippdorn

title: Firefox account synch locked
content:
Dear community,

I know that this seems to be an hot topic for questions, but after read some other messages I am confused on hot to proceed. This is my problem:

On a fresh installation of an Operating System on my laptop I tried to enable the firefox synch functions. After inser the password I was waiting for the pin code on my mail to certify my identity. This mail returned (I don't know why) and now my synch functions are locked. I am able to log in with my account: <jonathan.cacace@gmail.com> but I am not able to start synch. How can I solve this issue?

Regards,

title: generated passwords display on screen
content: I'd like to generate secure passwords and not have them display on the screen. If I am being "spied on" what good does displaying the password do? Why would I need to ever see an auto generated password in the first place? I mean I can click on the show password icon if I want to see it. Wouldn't someone simply be able to observe the password when it is displayed in regular text on my screen? Why doesn't the change password feature on my Firefox user account give me the option to "generate a secure password" in the first box, but the option shows up in the second "change password" box for confirming the password? Then it shows the new password so I can approve of it or something which seems to defeat the whole purpose of hiding the password in the first place. Doesn't seem all that secure and I'm no software or security engineer by the way. Maybe you can improve the security of the WIn 10 firefox browser a little.
creator: ltigro

title: Static lines popping up on certain sites
content:
Hey guys,

I'm having an issues where static lines appear on various sites. Here's an example: https://www.loom.com/share/f905f838d6464f73845173ee80f3eb7b

There is generally some kind of dynamic content on these pages. It occurs on both my 4K and 2K monitors.

I have a 2018 Huawei Matebook X Pro with an Nvidia MX150.

If I disable hardware acceleration, that fixes the issue, but makes Firefox virtually unusable since it's so slow. These lines don't appear in Chrome, so I know it's not a hardware issue.

Any ideas on how I can stop this from happening?


Thanks!
creator: sunnyt7

title: Firefox changed. I'm done
content: I've been a Firefox user for over 15 years. I preferred it to Chrome. But, that's all over now. Since I upgraded I have had nothing but misery. Pages don't function normally. Windows will not display properly, no matter what I set them. Worst of all with any single window, or multiple windows, the slightest mouse movement outside the window and every window comes forward, then it recedes. Back and forth - again and again. If the mouse moves away from the window boundaries, up comes on another window - not the one I want top work in. If that's not distracting enough, I will move the mouse out of the immediate area, what I type does not appear on the page - it goes to some small pseudo search bar which means That the mouse is on the empty desktop. Etc. Etc. I've had it. Too much distraction and poor functionality.
creator: jesshenryes

title: Browsing History will not delete
content: Updated to Firefox 83 and now my browsing history in 'History' and in 'Show All History' will not delete despite my preference settings being correct and having tried deletion in all possible ways. Something is wrong because after I have clicked 'Clear Recent History' or closed Firefox with 'Delete on closing' selected, the preference page shows a change in the kb being used to store history, yet the browsing history has not been cleared. Does anyone know how to fix this problem or let Firefox know?

title: Unwanted addition to Firefox window
content: My Firefox just updated and added an extra bar "For quick access, place your bookmarks here on the bookmarks toolbar. As I had already turned off the bookmarks toolbar because it used up unnecessary screen real estate, I am more than a little annoyed that a bar advertising something that I don't want, explicitly turned off, and no apparent way to remove, has suddenly appeared. If I am on a screen only 900px high, as one of the screens I use is, this is exceptionally annoying. Can it be switched off, and how? Adding unnecessary rubbish used to be the province of Internet Explorer. It would be a shame if FF followed that path.
creator: stardakev

title: Addons icons don't appear in toolbar
content: When I opened Firefox this morning, I got a pop-up I've never seen before, that said something like "Firefox is slow. Refresh Firefox." So I did that. Then I added back the add-ons I want to use. The add-ons are installed and working. But there are no icons in the toolbar. There is no overflow arrow. Just a blank space where the icons used to be. I've searched for solutions for two hours now. Can't figure it out.
creator: fastriver
